ac_units.description:
ACU-CMAS-001
DIMENSION_LOCK
dim(X) == 112
Enforcement: HARD_FAIL
Tolerance: 0

ACU-CMAS-003
STATE_EXPANSION_PROHIBITION
len(X) == 112
AND no runtime augmentation
Enforcement: HARD_FAIL

SECTION 2 — Coordinate Construction

ACU-CMAS-004
BOUNDED_SIGNAL
0 ≤ m[d,v] ≤ 1
0 ≤ i[d,v] ≤ 1
HARD_FAIL

ACU-CMAS-005
COORDINATE_DEFINITION
x[d,v] = m[d,v] * i[d,v]
Deterministic only.

SECTION 3 — Conditioning Operator P

ACU-CMAS-006
P.shape == (112,112)

ACU-CMAS-007
rank(P) == 112

ACU-CMAS-008
P immutable during runtime session

ACU-CMAS-009
dim(PX) == 112

SECTION 4 — Interaction Matrix W

ACU-CMAS-010
W.shape == (112,112)

ACU-CMAS-011
W == W.T

ACU-CMAS-012
Eigenvalues(W) ≥ 0

ACU-CMAS-013
max_eigenvalue(W) ≤ 1

ACU-CMAS-014
For each row i:
Σ_j |W[i,j]| ≤ κ
κ < 1

ACU-CMAS-015
Baseline Structural Mode:
W = γI
0 < γ < 1
Activated if predictive mode inactive.

SECTION 5 — Energy Definition

ACU-CMAS-016
E(X) = 0.5 * (PX)^T W (PX)

SECTION 6 — Structural Dynamics

ACU-CMAS-017
dX/dt = P^{-1} [ (W - αI)PX - β (PX ⊙ PX) ]
α > 0
0 < β < α

SECTION 7 — Stability

ACU-CMAS-018
J = (W - αI) - 2β diag(PX)

ACU-CMAS-019
instability = max(Re(eigenvalues(J))) > 0

ACU-CMAS-020
S(X) = - max(Re(eigenvalues(J)))
Classification:
S > 0 → stable
S = 0 → critical
S < 0 → unstable

SECTION 8 — Fragility

ACU-CMAS-021
v_max = eigenvector associated with max eigenvalue(J)

ACU-CMAS-022
F[i] = |v_max[i]|

SECTION 9 — Metric Tensor G

ACU-CMAS-023
G positive-definite

ACU-CMAS-024
||X||_G^2 = X^T G X

SECTION 10 — M&A Operator

ACU-CMAS-025
X_M = X_A + X_B

ACU-CMAS-026
ΔE = 2 (PX_A)^T W (PX_B)

ACU-CMAS-027
max(Re(eigenvalues(J(PX_M)))) < 0
Post-merger stability requirement.

SECTION 11 — Growth Multiplier

ACU-CMAS-029
ΔX ∝ P^{-1} W (PX)

SECTION 12 — Drift Monitoring

ACU-CMAS-030
Monitor:
dE/dt
dλ_max/dt
λ_max → 0⁻

SECTION 13 — Portfolio Contagion

ACU-CMAS-031
max(Re(eigenvalues(J_p))) > 0
Defines systemic instability.

SECTION 14 — Stress Simulation

ACU-CMAS-032
X' = X + ΔX
Recompute all structural observables.

SECTION 15 — Uncertainty Envelope

ACU-CMAS-033
||ΔX||_G ≤ ε

SECTION 16 — Immutability Enforcement

ACU-CMAS-034
Runtime modification prohibited for:
- State dimension
- Energy definition
- Stability definition
- Interaction matrix constraints
- Dynamical system
Violation → invalidate system.

Total ACUs: 34
Deterministic enforcement: Yes
Heuristic drift allowed: No

ACU-SMS-001
STATE_REFERENCE_LOCK
X ∈ R^112
Must match HG-CMAS dimensional definition.
Enforcement: HARD_FAIL

ACU-SMS-002
ONTOLOGY_LAYER_BOUNDARY
HG-SMS defines signal ontology only.
HG-SMS must NOT perform:
- normalization
- conditioning
- interaction learning
- stability computation
- predictive modeling
Violation → HARD_FAIL

SECTION 2 — Canonical Coordinate Construction Rule

ACU-SMS-003
COORDINATE_FORMULA
x[d,v] = m[d,v] * i[d,v]
Deterministic multiplication only.

ACU-SMS-004
SIGNAL_BOUNDS
0 ≤ m[d,v] ≤ 1
0 ≤ i[d,v] ≤ 1
Violation → HARD_FAIL

ACU-SMS-005
CONFIDENCE_DEFINITION
i[d,v] = c_data * c_verification
0 ≤ c_data ≤ 1
0 ≤ c_verification ≤ 1
Deterministic only.

SECTION 3 — Admissible Signal Properties

ACU-SMS-006
QUANTIFIABILITY_REQUIREMENT
signal must be computable from observable data
Subjective or non-observable signals → HARD_FAIL

ACU-SMS-007
REPRODUCIBILITY_REQUIREMENT
identical_inputs ⇒ identical_signal_output

ACU-SMS-008
MANIPULATION_RESISTANCE
Signals must be ratio-based, auditable, and resistant to gaming.

ACU-SMS-009
PROHIBITED_SIGNAL_TYPES
The following are disallowed:
- subjective leadership ratings
- cultural assessments
- sentiment analysis
- narrative strategy scoring
- survey-based soft metrics
Detection → HARD_FAIL

SECTION 4 — Dimensional Structure Enforcement

ACU-SMS-010
DIMENSION_GROUP_LOCK
Dimensions = {D1, D2, D3, D4, D5, D6, D7}
Each dimension contains exactly 16 vectors

ACU-SMS-011
FLATTENING_ORDER_LOCK
Canonical ordering = D1-V01 → D7-V16
No remapping permitted.

ACU-SMS-012
COORDINATE_COUNT_LOCK
Total coordinates = 7 × 16 = 112
Violation → HARD_FAIL

SECTION 5 — Dimension Domain Locks
Each domain must contain exactly the 16 defined signals from the constitutional document. No additions or removals permitted.

ACU-SMS-013
D1 — Capital Structure Integrity Lock
D1 contains exactly 16 defined capital structure signals

ACU-SMS-014
D2 — Governance & Control Lock
D2 contains exactly 16 defined governance/control signals

ACU-SMS-015
D3 — Temporal Risk Lock
D3 contains exactly 16 defined temporal risk signals

ACU-SMS-016
D4 — Information & Revenue Integrity Lock
D4 contains exactly 16 defined information/revenue signals

ACU-SMS-017
D5 — Market & Liquidity Lock
D5 contains exactly 16 defined market/liquidity signals

ACU-SMS-018
D6 — Execution Discipline Lock
D6 contains exactly 16 defined execution signals

ACU-SMS-019
D7 — Failure Visibility Lock
D7 contains exactly 16 defined failure-visibility signals

SECTION 6 — Ratio-Based Enforcement

ACU-SMS-020
Each signal must be expressible as:
- bounded scalar OR
- ratio of observable quantities
Narrative or heuristic scoring prohibited.

SECTION 7 — Code Audit Integration Constraint

ACU-SMS-021
Software metrics must:
- be ratio-based
- pass normalization rules (HG-ME layer)
- be confidence-weighted
- map into D4 or D6 only
No new dimensions allowed.

SECTION 8 — IP Audit Integration Constraint

ACU-SMS-022
IP metrics must:
- be ratio-based
- map into D1, D5, or D6
- not expand canonical dimension

SECTION 9 — Reaction Modeling Constraint

ACU-SMS-023
No strategic behavior simulation permitted.
Only observed outcome-based metrics allowed.
Violation → HARD_FAIL

SECTION 10 — Conditioning Separation

ACU-SMS-024
Signals populate canonical X before conditioning.
Conditioning operator P acts only after X construction.

SECTION 11 — Ontology Mutation Prohibition

ACU-SMS-025
Not allowed:
- adding new dimensions
- removing coordinates
- dynamic remapping
- qualitative overrides
- runtime ontology mutation
Violation → SYSTEM INVALID

SECTION 12 — Determinism Requirement

ACU-SMS-026
Identical inputs + identical configuration ⇒ identical canonical coordinates
No stochastic elements permitted.

SECTION 13 — Version Governance

ACU-SMS-027
Changes require:
- formal proposal
- empirical validation
- calibration impact analysis
- version increment
- governance approval
Silent changes prohibited.

Total ACUs: 27
Dimensional expansion permitted: NO
Narrative scoring permitted: NO
Heuristic drift permitted: NO
Runtime ontology mutation permitted: NO

ACU-ME-001
MEASUREMENT_AUTHORITY_LOCK
Only HG-ME may construct X ∈ R^112 from structured signals
Upstream or downstream layers modifying X → HARD_FAIL

ACU-ME-002
POST-ME_DETERMINISM_LOCK
After HG-ME execution, X must be deterministic
No stochastic operations allowed.

SECTION 2 — Canonical State Construction

ACU-ME-003
NORMALIZATION_RULE
m[d,v] = min(1, s[d,v] / P95[d,v | sector, stage, revenue])
Where:
s[d,v] = raw signal
P95 = empirical 95th percentile baseline
No global constants permitted.

ACU-ME-004
CONFIDENCE_WEIGHT_RULE
i[d,v] = c_data * c_verification
0 ≤ c_data ≤ 1
0 ≤ c_verification ≤ 1

ACU-ME-005
COORDINATE_CONSTRUCTION
x[d,v] = m[d,v] * i[d,v]

SECTION 3 — Calibration Dataset Requirements

ACU-ME-006
MINIMUM_SAMPLE_SIZE
dataset_size ≥ 50 companies
Preferred:
dataset_size ≥ 200 companies

ACU-ME-007
TIME_SERIES_REQUIREMENT
time_series_length ≥ 24 months

ACU-ME-008
OUTCOME_BALANCE_REQUIREMENT
failure_cases ≥ 20%
strong_positive_cases ≥ 20%

ACU-ME-009
DATASET_LOGGING
dataset_version must be immutable and logged

SECTION 4 — Industry-Adjusted Normalization

ACU-ME-010
SECTOR_STAGE_BASELINE
P95 derived empirically per (sector, stage, revenue band)

ACU-ME-011
SATURATION_RESPONSE
If saturation detected:
Recompute baseline OR
Adjust signal definition OR
Recalibrate dataset
Silent adjustment prohibited.

SECTION 5 — Distribution Stability Requirement

ACU-ME-012
MEAN_CONSTRAINT
0.35 ≤ μ ≤ 0.65

ACU-ME-013
STANDARD_DEVIATION_CONSTRAINT
0.15 ≤ σ ≤ 0.30
Violation → corrective action required.

SECTION 6 — Vector Independence Audit

ACU-ME-014
|corr(x_i, x_j)| ≤ 0.85
If violated:
- merge signals OR
- residualize OR
- redefine measurement

SECTION 7 — Sensitivity Stability Test

ACU-ME-015
Perturbation test:
x_i → x_i + ε
Constraint:
Shift in dominant eigenvalue ≤ 10%
Prevents single-vector dominance.

SECTION 8 — Energy Distribution Stability

ACU-ME-016
Energy distribution must avoid:
- concentration near zero
- saturation near maximum
- degenerate variance
If detected → recalibration required.

SECTION 9 — Temporal Signal Processing

ACU-ME-017
Allowed preprocessing:
- rolling averages
- variance stabilization
- deterministic outlier clipping
Subjective smoothing prohibited.

SECTION 10 — Historical Compatibility

ACU-ME-018
Historical states stored as X_t, X_{t-1}, ...
Canonical dimension must remain 112
No vector concatenation permitted.

SECTION 11 — Confidence Weight Control

ACU-ME-019
0.6 ≤ average_confidence ≤ 0.9
Outside bounds → recalibration required.

SECTION 12 — Data Sufficiency Gate (Live Use)

ACU-ME-020
Before output:
- completeness_ratio ≥ required threshold
- sector baseline available
- confidence within bounds
- required signals present
- sufficient time-series depth
If not:
Downgrade to structural mode
No manual override permitted.

SECTION 13 — Code & IP Integration

ACU-ME-021
Software and IP metrics must:
- be ratio-based
- normalized
- confidence-weighted
- satisfy distribution constraints
- map into existing coordinates

SECTION 14 — Reaction Measurement Constraint

ACU-ME-022
External reactions measured via observed outcomes only
No intent simulation permitted

SECTION 15 — Calibration Workflow Enforcement

ACU-ME-023
Workflow sequence:
1. Assemble dataset
2. Compute sector baselines
3. Normalize signals
4. Run distribution audit
5. Run correlation audit
6. Run sensitivity test
7. Approve version
8. Enable W training
Out-of-order execution prohibited.

SECTION 16 — Deployment Invariance

ACU-ME-024
Normalization rules invariant to:
- interaction matrix version
- structural/predictive mode
- client type
No dynamic normalization changes permitted.

SECTION 17 — Version Governance

ACU-ME-025
Changes require:
- version increment
- dataset reference
- calibration report
- parameter log
- governance approval
Silent changes prohibited.

SECTION 18 — Determinism Requirement

ACU-ME-026
Identical inputs + identical configuration ⇒ identical X
No stochastic elements permitted.

Total ACUs: 26
Normalization stochasticity permitted: NO
Silent recalibration permitted: NO
Vector dimension change permitted: NO
Manual override permitted: NO

ACU-WTA-001
SINGLE_LEARNED_OBJECT_LOCK
Only W ∈ R^(112×112) may be learned
Learning of:
P
X
stability rules
energy function
ontology
→ HARD_FAIL

ACU-WTA-002
MATRIX_DIMENSION_LOCK
W.shape == (112,112)

SECTION 2 — Conditioned Training State

ACU-WTA-003
Training input must use X~ = P X
P must be fixed and version-controlled.

SECTION 3 — Permissible Targets

ACU-WTA-004
ALLOWED_LABEL_TYPES
Binary collapse (3/6/12 months)
Ordinal deal outcome
Binary integration failure

ACU-WTA-005
PROHIBITED_TARGETS
Continuous return prediction prohibited
Violation → HARD_FAIL

SECTION 4 — Training Objective

ACU-WTA-006
ŷ_t = X~_t^T W X~_t

ACU-WTA-007
P(Y=1) = σ(X~_t^T W X~_t)

ACU-WTA-008
Loss(W) = Σ BCE + λ1||W||_F^2 + λ2 R_block(W)
Regularization mandatory.

SECTION 5 — Structural Constraints on W

ACU-WTA-009
SYMMETRIZATION
W ← (W + W^T)/2

ACU-WTA-010
PSD_PROJECTION
Eigenvalues(W) ≥ 0
Negative eigenvalues clipped to 0

ACU-WTA-011
SPECTRAL_NORMALIZATION
max_eigenvalue(W) ≤ 1
If violated → normalize.

ACU-WTA-012
ROW_DOMINANCE_ENFORCEMENT
Σ_j |W[i,j]| ≤ κ < 1
Rescale if violated.

SECTION 6 — Validation Discipline

ACU-WTA-013
Temporal split:
70% train
15% validation
15% test
No temporal leakage allowed.

ACU-WTA-014
≥ 20% company holdout

ACU-WTA-015
MINIMUM_PERFORMANCE_STANDARDS
Median lead time ≥ 6 months
False positive rate ≤ 20%
Metrics must include:
ROC-AUC
Precision/Recall
Failure → predictive activation denied.

SECTION 7 — Horizon-Specific Models

ACU-WTA-016
Separate classifiers required for:
3-month
6-month
12-month

ACU-WTA-017
Maximum predictive horizon ≤ 24 months

SECTION 8 — Overvaluation Detection

ACU-WTA-018
Compare structural energy trajectory vs market valuation trajectory
Divergence regime if valuation ↑ and reinforcement ↓

SECTION 9 — Integration Risk Modeling

ACU-WTA-019
X_M = X_A + X_B
X~_M = P X_M
λ_max(J(X~_M)) used as feature

SECTION 10 — Reinforcement Detection

ACU-WTA-020
Detect transitions:
Low energy → sustained high energy regimes
No prediction of founder ability or innovation quality permitted.

SECTION 11 — Residual Monitoring

ACU-WTA-021
Monitor:
AUC drift
False positive increase
Calibration bias
Sector degradation
Triggers review only.

SECTION 12 — Retraining Policy

ACU-WTA-022
Retraining allowed only if:
Dataset size increase ≥ 25%
OR structural regime shift
OR performance degradation beyond threshold
Continuous online learning prohibited.

SECTION 13 — Predictive Activation Gate

ACU-WTA-023
Predictive mode may activate only if:
Validated W exists
Performance metrics documented
Dataset ID logged
Governance approval recorded
Version registered
Else:
W = γI
Structural mode enforced

SECTION 14 — Deployment Constraints

ACU-WTA-024
Not allowed:
Silent W replacement
Partial model updates
Client-specific training
Frontend-only toggles

SECTION 15 — Determinism Requirement

ACU-WTA-025
Identical inputs + identical W version ⇒ identical outputs
Randomness prohibited in inference.

Total ACUs: 25
Continuous learning permitted: NO
Unregistered W permitted: NO
Return prediction permitted: NO
Silent model change permitted: NO

ACU-ALMS-001
UPSTREAM_IMMUTABILITY_LOCK
HG-ALMS must not modify:
- Canonical state X
- Conditioned state X~ = P X
- Interaction matrix W
- Conditioning matrix P
- Energy definition
- Stability definition
Violation → HARD_FAIL

SECTION 2 — Core Input Requirements

ACU-ALMS-002
Required inputs per entity at time t:
X_t
X~_t
E(X_t)
S(X_t)
Jacobian spectrum
Fragility vector F_t
Optional (if predictive mode active):
Collapse probabilities
Integration risk probabilities
Overvaluation classification

SECTION 3 — Pre-Deal Structural Classification

ACU-ALMS-003
Classification must derive strictly from:
E(X)
S(X)
Fragility vector
Predictive probabilities (if active)
No heuristic scoring permitted.

SECTION 4 — Zero-to-One Reinforcement Detection

ACU-ALMS-004
Structural reinforcement requires:
dE/dt > 0
S(X) > 0
Fragility concentration low
Execution discipline stable
All must be computed deterministically.

SECTION 5 — Growth Pivot Engine (2× / 5× / 10×)

ACU-ALMS-005
Objective:
Minimize ||ΔX||_G
Subject to: E(X + ΔX) ≥ k E(X)
k ∈ {2,5,10}

ACU-ALMS-006
First-order direction:
ΔX ∝ P^{-1} W (P X)
Output must include:
Required magnitude
Target dimensions
Stability impact

SECTION 6 — Collapse Detection

ACU-ALMS-007
Structural early warning independent of predictive layer:
λ_max(J) → 0⁻
Increasing instability drift
Rising fragility concentration
Execution degradation

ACU-ALMS-008
Predictive collapse classification allowed only if predictive mode active.
Otherwise structural-only outputs permitted.

SECTION 7 — Overvaluation Detection

ACU-ALMS-009
Compare structural energy trajectory vs valuation trajectory
If valuation ↑ AND structural reinforcement ↓
→ Divergence classification

SECTION 8 — Integration Risk (M&A)

ACU-ALMS-010
X_M = X_A + X_B
X~_M = P X_M
Evaluate stability and fragility redistribution

ACU-ALMS-011
Post-merger monitoring must track:
Stability drift
Execution degradation
Synergy realization

SECTION 9 — Capital Exit / Restructuring Support

ACU-ALMS-012
Recommendations may consider:
Collapse probability
Instability drift
Fragility concentration
Execution deterioration
Outputs remain advisory.

SECTION 10 — Continuous Monitoring Engine

ACU-ALMS-013
Periodic workflow:
Update data
Recompute X_t
Recompute energy & stability
Measure drift
Evaluate predictive models (if active)
Generate alerts
Fully deterministic.

SECTION 11 — Portfolio Contagion Modeling

ACU-ALMS-014
Construct block Jacobian across entities
Detect max(Re(eigenvalues(J_p))) > 0

SECTION 12 — Structural Stress Simulation

ACU-ALMS-015
X' = X + ΔX
Recompute E(X'), S(X'), Fragility
Perturbation magnitude measured using G.

SECTION 13 — Structural Uncertainty Envelope

ACU-ALMS-016
||ΔX||_G ≤ ε
Compute stability range
Classify robustness:
Robust
Moderately robust
Fragile

SECTION 14 — Historical Drift Analysis

ACU-ALMS-017
Using stored states:
Compute energy trend
Compute stability trend
Compute fragility migration
Detect acceleration of deterioration
Historical data must not expand state dimension.

SECTION 15 — Output Integrity

ACU-ALMS-018
Outputs must be:
- Deterministic
- Structured
- Version-logged
- Derived strictly from canonical mathematics
Narrative scoring prohibited.

SECTION 16 — Institutional Boundary

ACU-ALMS-019
System must not claim:
- guaranteed returns
- exact collapse timing
- elimination of uncertainty
Classification only.

SECTION 17 — Determinism Requirement

ACU-ALMS-020
Identical inputs + identical versions ⇒ identical outputs
No stochastic variation permitted.

Total ACUs: 20
Upstream mutation permitted: NO
Heuristic scoring permitted: NO
Advisory override permitted: NO
Stochastic outputs permitted: NO

ACU-ARCH-001
LAYER_PRECEDENCE_LOCK
Execution order must be:
HG-CMAS →
HG-SMS →
HG-ME →
Conditioning (P) →
HG-WTA →
HG-ALMS →
HG-ARCH →
HG-OGIP
No downstream layer may override upstream outputs.
Violation → SYSTEM INVALID

SECTION 2 — Raw Data Immutability

ACU-ARCH-002
RAW_DATA_IMMUTABLE
All raw inputs must be stored immutably.
No overwriting permitted.

ACU-ARCH-003
SOURCE_TRACEABILITY
All raw inputs must be timestamped and source-identified.

SECTION 3 — Extraction Layer Constraints

ACU-ARCH-004
EXTRACTION_SCOPE_LIMIT
Allowed:
- Parsing financial tables
- Extracting contractual terms
- Detecting capital structure elements
- Computing code metrics
- Extracting governance data
- Identifying revenue characteristics
Not allowed:
- Stability computation
- Collapse prediction
- Interaction learning
- Heuristic scoring
Violation → HARD_FAIL

ACU-ARCH-005
SCHEMA_VALIDATION_REQUIRED
Each extracted field must pass:
- Type validation
- Unit validation
- Range validation
- Completeness checks
- Consistency checks

SECTION 4 — Measurement Execution Enforcement

ACU-ARCH-006
HG-ME must execute before conditioning.

ACU-ARCH-007
After HG-ME, X must be deterministic.

SECTION 5 — Conditioning Enforcement

ACU-ARCH-008
Conditioning operator P retrieved by version ID.
P must be version-controlled.

SECTION 6 — Structural Kernel Execution

ACU-ARCH-009
Kernel must compute:
Energy E(X)
Stability index S(X)
Jacobian spectrum
Fragility vector
Drift metrics (if history exists)
Computation must be deterministic.

SECTION 7 — Predictive Layer Activation

ACU-ARCH-010
Predictive layer executes only if validated W version active.
Else structural mode enforced.
No implicit activation allowed.

SECTION 8 — Application Layer Integrity

ACU-ARCH-011
Outputs must be:
- Deterministic
- Version-logged
- Structured
- Derived from upstream layers only

SECTION 9 — Historical State Management

ACU-ARCH-012
Store X_t, X_{t-1}, ...
Historical storage must not alter canonical dimension (112).

SECTION 10 — Continuous Monitoring Engine

ACU-ARCH-013
Automated cycle:
Ingest updates
Recompute X_t
Apply conditioning
Recompute structural metrics
Compare with prior states
Generate alerts
Manual override prohibited.

SECTION 11 — Data Sufficiency Gate

ACU-ARCH-014
Before predictive outputs:
Verify:
- Time-series depth
- Confidence thresholds
- Signal completeness
- Sector baseline coverage
- Required variables present
If insufficient:
Automatic downgrade to structural mode
No override permitted.

SECTION 12 — Multi-Tenant Isolation

ACU-ARCH-015
System must enforce:
Tenant-isolated storage
Stateless compute services
Immutable audit logs
Version-aware execution
Cross-tenant contamination → SYSTEM INVALID

SECTION 13 — Security Controls

ACU-ARCH-016
Required:
Encryption at rest
Encryption in transit
Role-based access control
Audit logging
Tenant isolation
Secure key management

SECTION 14 — Version Registry Enforcement

ACU-ARCH-017
Every execution must log:
CMAS version
SMS version
ME version
Conditioning matrix version
W version and mode
ALMS version
ARCH version
Dataset ID (if predictive)
Timestamp
Missing metadata → OUTPUT INVALID

SECTION 15 — Operational Risk Controls

ACU-ARCH-018
Prevent:
Silent normalization changes
Unauthorized model updates
Cross-tenant contamination
Manual overrides
Unlogged configuration changes
Violation → SYSTEM INVALID

SECTION 16 — Deployment Modes

ACU-ARCH-019
Structural Mode (Default):
W = γI
No probabilistic forecasts
Fully deterministic
Predictive Mode requires governance approval.

SECTION 17 — Portfolio-Level Processing

ACU-ARCH-020
Must support:
Correlation structures
Contagion modeling
Sector exposure analysis
Systemic risk detection
All derived from canonical mathematics.

SECTION 18 — Stress Simulation Infrastructure

ACU-ARCH-021
Apply deterministic perturbations to X
Recompute structural observables
Magnitude measured via metric G.

SECTION 19 — Infrastructure Integrity Principles

ACU-ARCH-022
Architecture must ensure:
Deterministic execution
Reproducibility
Traceability
Scalability
Security
Isolation
Operational shortcuts prohibited.

Total ACUs: 22
Layer bypass permitted: NO
Silent configuration change permitted: NO
Manual override permitted: NO
Cross-tenant contamination permitted: NO

ACU-OGIP-001
CANONICAL_MATHEMATICS_LOCK
All outputs must derive exclusively from:
X ∈ R^112
X~ = P X
E(X) = 0.5 X~^T W X~
S(X) = - max(Re(eigenvalues(J(X~))))
Alternative scoring systems → HARD_FAIL

SECTION 2 — Deterministic Reproducibility

ACU-OGIP-002
Identical inputs + identical versions ⇒ identical outputs
Stochastic production inference prohibited.

SECTION 3 — No Manual Overrides

ACU-OGIP-003
Prohibited manual modification of:
- X
- X~
- Energy values
- Stability index
- Fragility vectors
- Collapse classifications
- Interaction matrix W
- Conditioning matrix P
Violation → SYSTEM INVALID

SECTION 4 — No Heuristic Scoring

ACU-OGIP-004
Disallowed:
Subjective ratings
Narrative risk scores
Cultural assessments
Red-flag tagging
Qualitative overrides
All outputs must be mathematically derived.

SECTION 5 — Operational Modes

ACU-OGIP-005
STRUCTURAL_MODE_DEFAULT
W = γI
No probabilistic forecasts

ACU-OGIP-006
PREDICTIVE_MODE_RESTRICTED
Predictive mode requires validated W version and governance approval.
Implicit activation prohibited.

SECTION 6 — Predictive Activation Requirements

ACU-OGIP-007
Predictive mode may activate only if:
Validated W version
Documented performance metrics
Approved calibration dataset
Governance authorization
Version registration
Explicit activation flag
Missing condition → Structural mode enforced.

SECTION 7 — Horizon Limits

ACU-OGIP-008
Allowed horizons: 3, 6, 12 months
Maximum absolute horizon: 24 months
Longer forecasts prohibited.

SECTION 8 — Data Sufficiency Enforcement

ACU-OGIP-009
Before predictive outputs:
Verify:
Signal completeness
Confidence thresholds
Sector baseline availability
Time-series depth
Required variables present
If insufficient:
Automatic downgrade to structural mode
No override allowed.

SECTION 9 — Version Metadata Requirements

ACU-OGIP-010
Every output must include:
CMAS version
SMS version
ME version
Conditioning matrix version
W version and mode
ALMS version
ARCH version
Dataset ID (if predictive)
Timestamp
Missing metadata → OUTPUT INVALID

SECTION 10 — Change Control Protocol

ACU-OGIP-011
Changes to any of the following require governance approval:
Mathematical definitions
State dimensionality
Signal ontology
Normalization rules
Conditioning matrices
Interaction matrix constraints
Training objectives
Prediction targets
Silent changes prohibited.
